paper.title: SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccines sensitize tumours to immune checkpoint blockade

core_question: Can intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine create an interferon-rich inflammatory tumor state that improves sensitivity to anti-PD-L1 immune checkpoint blockade?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse efficacy cohort (combination therapy)
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Preclinical efficacy set of tumor-bearing mice treated with an intratumoral mRNA vaccine in combination with anti-PD-L1, pooled across repeated experiments to evaluate tumor control.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse control cohort (vaccine only, ICI only, vehicle)
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Matched preclinical control mice receiving vaccine-only, ICI-only, or vehicle conditions, used to benchmark whether the combination effect exceeds single-agent activity.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human retrospective metastatic cohort
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Retrospective, non-randomized translational cohort of metastatic patients receiving immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment, compared by prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human vaccinated subgroup
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Subset of the retrospective metastatic cohort with prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination, used for survival comparison under ICI treatment.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human unvaccinated subgroup
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Subset of the retrospective metastatic cohort without prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination, serving as the comparator group for outcomes under ICI therapy.

major_limitations: The human analysis was retrospective and non-randomized, so residual confounding is likely.
Vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients, complicating interpretation.
Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation.
Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.
Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across settings.
